data.title: Cannot Force Quit / Remove from Memory Large Built JS File

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.11.2 (1.11.2)
- OS Version: MacOS Sierra 10.12.4 

I had a large build JS file open (from Webpack bundle) in VSCode with unsaved changes. I deleted the file from the command line as part of a build-script. Thus, the file no longer existed on the file system. Thus, when attempting to save and close all tabs, the editor prompted me to save this file; however, it then hung, and I was forced to force-quit VSCode. Now, every time I open VSCode, it reopens the file and immediately hangs. I've tried leaving for hours, force quitting, deleting vscode and reinstall (soft - I don't want to blow away all my extensions if possible), restarting, cleaning app memory and caches, etc. The file always re-opens whenever I open the folder where my project is. I tried renaming the folder and now the file opens in a separate window at least so I can resume working, but the file is still always around as an unsaved file (and again, its deleted from the file system OS). How can I delete it from VSCode's memory.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a large Webpack Built JS file. 
2. Delete it from the command line outside the editor.
3. Attempt to close the editor - prompt for unsaved changes save
4. Editor hangs
5. Force quit
6. Stuck.

data.title: Quick fix for imports introduces double quotes: is there a workaround?
data.body:
In our [Coding Guidelines](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Coding-Guidelines#strings) we have agreed on using *single quotes* for strings unless the string is a natural language string. Now do this:

* open search viewlet
* search for `^import .+ from "[\w/]+";$` (which matches double quoted imports like `import * as foo from "foo"`)
* 😱 hundreds of matches in hundred of files


![screen shot 2017-04-26 at 18 10 44](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1794099/25444503/b0ff09aa-2aab-11e7-95d4-c5d1df188bd6.png)


My guess is that this is caused because of the TypeScript quick fix inserting import with double quotes and not allowing for customisation in that area. 

cc @bpasero who seems to be a heavy user of this feature
cc @mjbvz who has proxy-ownership of this feature

data.title: Go To Definition/Declaration and back
data.body: How to go back after using Go To Definition/Declaration

data.title: Go Back / Go Ahead not the best match for swiping
data.body:
Testing #25325

Swiping invokes Go Back / Go Ahead which move the cursor to previous / next locations, also in the same editor.
As the OSX settings say 'swipe between pages', it would be more consistent if we had a Previous/Next Editor command.

data.title: Ugly flicker upon first startup
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. pick a slow OS for testing (e.g. Windows 7)
2. use the --user-data-dir to ensure first startup
3. pass a folder to open to have more UI to see it

=> the explorer is initially black and then white. I would assume this is much more obvious on slower machines

![panel-red](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/25442217/be8467c0-2aa4-11e7-9d9f-5d3a8f997327.gif)

data.title: Extension: How to avoid multiple entries of the command at the same time
data.body:
We had an async command such as the following code snippets. We want avoid run this command multiple entries at the same time.  So how to achieve this goal in the VSCode extnesion? Is there any mechanism to help us to do this?  Thanks. 

```javascript
    context.subscriptions.push(vscode.commands.registerCommand("extension.asyncCommand", async () => await somePromise()));
```

data.title: No key repeat in integrated terminal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: MacOS 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open integrated terminal.
2. Hold down a key; nothing should happen.

Single hits to key do act normally.

I have a non-standard key repeat:

To check or set, execute: open ~/Library/Preferences/.GlobalPreferences.plist

KeyRepeat: 1
InitialKeyRepeat: 10

data.title: Using SHIFT and arrow keys to select text to the right is ungodly slow
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2 (1.11.2)
- OS Version: Sierra (10.12.4)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a file
2. Put the cursor somewhere
3. Hold shift
4. Press the right arrow a few times
5. Wait for seconds for anything to happen

Happens with all plugins disabled, so it's an internal problem.

data.title: Theme generator: questionable work flow
data.body:
Testing #25341

Today I have converted a theme fully to the new colors (Abyss) and I was super happy being able to do this from our settings override and by seeing the changes live in the running instance. This was smooth enough that I question our generator approach where I am inside a theme and have to launch it to try it out. I think no theme author would be happy about this and we should advertise the flow via settings better. For example, we could have a snippet in settings that fills in all the colors categorized by name (similar to what I posted in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/25327#issue-224236610

data.title: Emmet: Double suggestions?
data.body:
Testing #25358

Type `area`. What is the difference between the first two suggestions?

![kapture 2017-04-26 at 16 04 46](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/25438520/17518d7a-2a9a-11e7-9717-af32c357b94b.gif)

Additionally, picking the second suggestion does nothing. Why is it there?

data.title: PowerShell Debugging does not start correctly if calling script from Powershell Terminal in VS.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:03:11.395Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.0|
|tslint|eg2|0.11.0|
|odoo-snippets|jeffery9|0.2.5|
|MagicPython|magicstack|1.0.9|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.8.1|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.12.2|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.7.2|
|python|tht13|0.2.3|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. If you set a break point in a PS script, then in the Powershell Terminal run that script, it says that it stops at the break point, however visually there is nothing shown. Looking at the file shows no sign of it being stopped there. Hitting F10 does nothing. Hitting F5 (which normally would work properly) at this point just hangs as if it's waiting for something.

data.title: Theme generator: trying out theme must work without switching to the theme
data.body:
Testing: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/25341

I think it is bad that we ask theme authors to switch to the theme in the extension target after launching. This causes some serious issues because we write this to the user settings and also impacts the main dev environment (which then fails to load the theme and falls back to some very broken state).

I think we should introduce a new startup paramenter that allows to pass over the theme to use so that upon launching this theme is being used without the user having to switch it. The theme being worked on should exclusively only be used in the extension environment that we launch, not the main side.

data.title: Emmet: `html:5` and `html:xml` snippets don't work
data.body:
Related to #25358

In an HTML file, type `html`. There are three suggestions. Two of them are `html:5` and `html:xml`. Their description indicates that they are snippets. When selecting them, all you get is literally `html:5` and `html:xml` and not what they initially indicated.

The snippets are only expanded if `html:5` or `html:xml` is already in the buffer.

![kapture 2017-04-26 at 16 01 38](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/25438412/a9e0ceb8-2a99-11e7-9a30-f8344dcc330c.gif)

data.title: Theme generator: colors for light theme should be used

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/25341

I created a light theme from the generator and gave it a try, but the result is quite ugly:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/25438170/e26124be-2a98-11e7-914c-061121cfcb6d.png)

If the theme should really be "fresh", then maybe no workbench color should be filled in? Or some colors, but the same we use for light, dark or hc theme?

data.title: Switch between recent files Immediately
data.body: When you press `CMD+P` it shows the active file at first place and it's highlighted. So it makes me press `down_arrow+enter` to switch to the last opened file. It would be better if the last opened file is highlighted first instead of highlighting the active file when you press `CMD+P`.

data.title: Skip TS restart confirmation
data.body:
Testing #25334

Why do we even ask the user whether to restart the TS language service? Both times this popup shows up was due to a user-made action, not some automatic action in the background, so the most obvious choice is to just restart the TypeScript server anyway.

data.body: I have opened VSCode on my home folder and the console shows this: `ipc.cp.ts:152[IPC Library: Watcher] Error: ELOOP: too many symbolic links encountered, stat '/Users/jrieken/.vscode-oss-dev/.vscode-oss/.code-oss-dev'`

data.title: Powershell Terminal gets really messed up when accepting input
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:03:11.395Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.0|
|tslint|eg2|0.11.0|
|odoo-snippets|jeffery9|0.2.5|
|MagicPython|magicstack|1.0.9|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.8.1|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.12.2|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.7.2|
|python|tht13|0.2.3|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Debug any Powershell script and then say it prompts you for input, or it has a mandatory parameter. When you type of paste text initially it goes crazy by almost sending an Enter after each letter, and it ends up just being stuck there.

Here's how it looks on my screen:
                               c

                                 d

Here's my typing the word "clear":

[DBG]: PS C:\xx> c
[DBG]: PS C:\xx>
[DBG]: PS C:\xx> l
[DBG]: PS C:\xx>
[DBG]: PS C:\xx> e
[DBG]: PS C:\xx>
[DBG]: PS C:\xx> a
[DBG]: PS C:\xx>
[DBG]: PS C:\x> r

data.title: Consider to use dots instead of camel-case
data.body:
re #25328

The theme-color-names use camel-casing, like `inactiveTabInactiveGroupForeground`, which is weird because in settings et al we use dot-separation, like `workbench.editor.showTabs`.

data.title: Settings getting wiped out

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Please provide the steps or scenarios how you landed into this particular issue of settings getting wiped out. It will be helpful to understand the root cause and fix it.

Meanwhile I would also think about recovery/prevention strategy.
